intro: Psychotria carnea, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround its small white flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elliptical with a glossy surface and a dark green color. Psychotria carnea is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
